title: City breathes easy as rain washes air clean | Ludhiana News - Times of India
text: Ludhiana: For a change, air in the city is light and refreshing. With rain over the last two days washing away dirt and grime, residents breathed the cleanest air in the last over two months. According to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) bulletin of Thursday, air quality index (measure of air quality in an area) in Ludhiana was recorded at 45, which falls under the good air quality bracket with minimal impact on health.Last time AQI in Ludhiana was less than Thursday’s value was on April 30, when it was recorded at 42. It was second lowest on July 3, when it was recorded at 63 (moderate category). Highest AQI in the last more than two months in Ludhiana was 241 on on June 5 (poor air quality bracket).111499857 Ludhiana was at third position in the state in terms of AQI on Thursday. Rupnagar had the lowest AQI of 27, followed by Patiala with AQI of 33. Amritsar had the highest AQI among cities of the state on Thursday. Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) officials said that the rain had washed away pollutants in the air, bringing AQI down. They also said that once rainfall decreased, air quality would deteriorate again due to vehicular traffic, commercial activity and construction works.Meanwhile, many residents said that they would want a permanent solution to the problem of air pollution in the city. Narinder Singh, a city resident said that instead of rejoicing over a temporary improvement, they wanted a permanent solution. He said that government departments and residents had to come together and work towards this. He also underlined the need to enhance the city’s green cover.
